channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Gleision: Call for inquest into mining disaster 10 years on
item.description: The families of four miners who died when water flooded the Gleision drift mine say questions remain.

item.title: Covid: 45-minute wait warning as school buses face disruption
item.description: One of Wales' largest councils face disruption due to the number of drivers and helpers isolating.

item.title: Swansea riots: Mayhill residents to speak to review about violence
item.description: Their views about the Mayhill riots, which saw seven police officers injured, will form part of a review.

item.title: Tomos Rhys Bunford, 9, crushed by vehicle was 'funny and loving'
item.description: Tomos Rhys Bunford was killed by a vehicle in a field close to his home earlier this month.

item.title: Capel Celyn: Memorial chapel reopens after conservation work
item.description: Capel Celyn was built to commemorate a village that was drowned to create a reservoir.

item.title: Meningitis: Magor boy's illness not diagnosed before his death
item.description: Logan Jones, 8, died of meningitis several days after being taken to hospital, an inquest hears.

item.title: Trial set for Pembrokeshire man over racist podcast site charges
item.description: James Allchurch denies 15 counts of distributing a sound recording stirring up racial hatred.

item.title: Alun Wyn Jones: Wales captain not ready for final playing chapter
item.description: After releasing his autobiography, Wales captain Alun Wyn Jones says he is not quite ready to finish the final chapter of his illustrious playing career.

item.title: Universal credit cut will push workers into poverty, warns Tory former minister
item.description: Former cabinet minister Stephen Crabb joins calls to axe the universal credit cut as Labour pushes for a vote.

item.title: Senedd deal: Five things Labour and Plaid Cymru could agree on
item.description: Five things they could agree on, and one thing they won't in talks on a deal.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Appeal for man who may have information
item.description: Police say he has done nothing wrong but could help inquiries into the fatal attack on Gary Jenkins.

item.title: Day care centres: Reduced hours affecting disabled adults, carers say
item.description: Sian Thomas's mother says her total care hours have been reduced from 39 a week to six.

item.title: Pennies back in production as cash is hoarded during Covid
item.description: No new 1p coins were made by the Royal Mint in 2018 and 2019 but production resumed last year.

item.title: Gleision: 'Guilt of surviving mine disaster with me forever'
item.description: A decade on from the Gleision mine disaster, two men who survived still carry the weight of the tragedy.

item.title: Carers: 'Going to the day centre is our break'
item.description: Carers fear day centres for disabled adults could be closed during a council's review of services.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Eluned Morgan announces booster jab plan
item.description: Eluned Morgan explains the Covid vaccination plans for 12 to 15-year-olds and the over-50s.

item.title: 'There's no emergency service for mental health'
item.description: Mental health specialists say people do not know where to turn, so are calling the police.

item.title: The Snowdonia bogs attracting rare birds back to Wales
item.description: Curlews and golden plovers have returned to marshland after not being seen since the 1990s.

item.title: Glyn Summers fall death: Family 'can't rest' without answers
item.description: Glyn Summers' family are calling for a full public inquiry.

item.title: Jess Fishlock: Wales' most-capped player has qualifying hope
item.description: Jess Fishlock believes this can be the campaign when Wales' women reach a major tournament for the first time.

item.title: Wales' World Cup qualifiers to be shown live on BBC Cymru Wales
item.description: Wales' 2023 Women's World Cup qualifying games will all be shown live by BBC Cymru Wales.

item.title: County Championship: Zafar Gohar spins Gloucestershire to win at Glamorgan
item.description: Pakistan spinner Zafar Gohar finishes with six for 43 as Gloucestershire thrashed Glamorgan by 10 wickets with two sessions to spare.

item.title: Wales and New Zealand match declared a sellout
item.description: Wales' autumn international against New Zealand in Cardiff on 30 October is declared a sellout.

item.title: Russell Martin: Swansea City boss expected to go through 'pain' at Championship club
item.description: Head coach Russell Martin says he knew there would be "pain" after taking charge at Swansea City as he tries to make his mark at the Championship club.

item.title: Galw am gwest i drychineb pwll glo Gleision wedi 10 mlynedd
item.description: Teuluoedd pedwar fu farw yng nglofa Gleision yn 2011 yn dweud bod cwestiynau i'w hateb o hyd.

item.title: Pum peth y gallai Llafur a Phlaid Cymru gytuno arnynt
item.description: Pum peth y gallent gytuno arnynt, ac un peth na fyddan nhw mewn trafodaethau yn y Senedd.

item.title: Teyrnged teulu i fachgen 'direidus, doniol a serchus'
item.description: Bu farw Tomos Rhys Bunford, 9, ar Ã´l cael ei wasgu gan gerbyd mewn cae ger ei gartref yn Ynysybwl.

item.title: Natalie Jones: "Barod i gwffio dros eraill"
item.description: Yr athrawes Gymraeg sy' eisiau annog pobl o bob cefndir i fynd i'r proffesiwn

item.title: Morgannwg yn cael cweir arall yn erbyn Sir Gaerloyw
item.description: Sir Gaerloyw yn cwblhau buddugoliaeth gyfforddus yn erbyn Morgannwg ar fore'r diwrnod olaf yng Nghaerdydd.
